com.alicecallsbob.fcsdk.android.phone

Interface Phone

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ListenerTarget<PhoneListener>

    public interface Phone
extends ListenerTarget<PhoneListener>
    An object that acts as the entry point for all voice and video calls.

    • Field Summary

      • setVideoOrientation

        @Deprecated
void setVideoOrientation(int orientation)
        Deprecated. 
        This method is deprecated; calling it has no effect. The SDK now automatically handles device rotation.
        Parameters:
        orientation - The orientation of the video to be sent
        See Also:
        Surface.ROTATION_0, Surface.ROTATION_90, Surface.ROTATION_180, Surface.ROTATION_270

      • setCamera

        void setCamera(int camera)
        Sets the camera index to use as the video source. Changing the camera takes effect immediately, even during an active call.

        If the SDK user does not call this operation, the SDK defaults to the first front facing camera it can find. If there is no front facing camera, the index of the first rear facing camera is returned.

        Parameters:
        camera - The camera index to use as the video source.

      • enableLocalAudio

        void enableLocalAudio(boolean isAudioEnabled)
        Enables or disables local streams.
        Parameters:
        isAudioEnabled - Whether local audio should be enabled.

      • enableLocalVideo

        void enableLocalVideo(boolean isVideoEnabled)
        Enables or disables local streams.
        Parameters:
        isVideoEnabled - Whether local video should be enabled.

      • releaseCamera

        void releaseCamera()
        Release the camera if it is in use.

      • createCall

        Call createCall(java.lang.String address,
                MediaDirection audioDirection,
                MediaDirection videoDirection,
                CallListener listener)
         throws CallCreationWithErrorException
        Create a call to the given remote address.
        Parameters:
        address - Address of the callee.
        audioDirection - Required audio direction.
        videoDirection - Required video direction.
        listener - The call listener.
        Returns:
        The new call
        Throws:
        CallCreationWithErrorException

      • createCall

        Call createCall(java.lang.String address,
                boolean audio,
                boolean video,
                CallListener listener)
         throws CallCreationWithErrorException
        Deprecated. Use MediaDirection parameters instead of booleans.
        Creates a call to the given remote address.

        Note that the SDK only supports one call at a time. If you attempt to create a call whilst another is already in pregress, then the call creation will fail.

        Parameters:
        address - The remote address.
        audio - Whether to use audio.
        video - Whether to use video.
        listener - The call listener.
        Returns:
        The new call
        Throws:
        CallCreationWithErrorException - if call creation failed

      • getRecommendedCaptureSettings

        java.util.List<PhoneVideoCaptureSetting> getRecommendedCaptureSettings()

        Returns:
        The recommended video capture settings

      • setPreferredCaptureResolution

        void setPreferredCaptureResolution(PhoneVideoCaptureResolution resolution)
        Sets the preferred video captured resolution. NOTE: a different resolution may be selected if the preferred resolution cannot be used.
        Parameters:
        resolution - The preferred video capture resolution

      • setPreferredCaptureFrameRate

        void setPreferredCaptureFrameRate(int frameRate)
        Sets the preferred video capture framerate. NOTE: a different framework may be selected if the preferred framerate is not supported
        Parameters:
        frameRate -

      • getPreferredCaptureResolution

      • getPreferredCaptureFrameRate

        int getPreferredCaptureFrameRate()
        Returns the preferred capture framerate.
        Returns:
        the preferred framerate

      • getCamera

        int getCamera()
        Returns the user selected camera index being used for capturing the video source.

        If the SDK user has not called setCamera(int), the SDK defaults to the first front facing camera it can find. If there is no front facing camera, the index of the first rear facing camera is returned.

        Returns:
        the selected camera index as an int.

      • setFlashlightMode

        void setFlashlightMode(int flashMode)
        Sets flashlight mode.
        Parameters:
        flashMode - FLASH_MODE_OFF | FLASH_MODE_TORCH

      • setFocusArea

        void setFocusArea(android.hardware.camera2.params.MeteringRectangle[] focusArea)
        Sets focus area - can only be used for API 21 or above
        Parameters:
        focusArea - the focus area

      • getAudioDeviceManager

        AudioDeviceManager getAudioDeviceManager()
        Returns the AudioDeviceManager. This is used to query and set the available devices for a call.
        Returns:
        the audio device manager in use

      • destroy

        void destroy()
        Releases the resources used by the Phone object.
